actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

official_title: A bill to establish an Office of Outreach Coordination in the Social Security Administration to coordinate the delivery of services to homeless individuals, to provide grants to local governments and nonprofit organizations to provide outreach to such individuals, and for other purposes.
subjects: Department of Health and Human Services
Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Homelessness Outreach Act of 1992 - Directs the Secretary of Health and Human Services to: (1) establish within the Social Security Administration an Office of Outreach Coordination to coordinate outreach efforts directed toward securing Federal assistance for eligible homeless individuals; (2) provide grants to local governments and nonprofit organizations for homeless outreach activities; and (3) prepare an evaluation for the Congress of the activities carried out under this Act. Sets forth special procedures governing the administration of social security benefits for homeless individuals.

titles.title: A bill to establish an Office of Outreach Coordination in the Social Security Administration to coordinate the delivery of services to homeless individuals, to provide grants to local governments and nonprofit organizations to provide outreach to such individuals, and for other purposes.
